DataElement.preferredName: During Hematopoietic Cell Graft Manipulation T-Cell Differentiation Antigen CD6 Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not t-cell differentiation antigen CD6 was used during the hematopoietic cell graft manipulation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: During Hematopoietic Cell Graft Manipulation T-Cell Differentiation Antigen CD6 Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._T-cell differentiation antigen CD6 (668 aa, ~72 kDa) is encoded by the human CD6 gene. This protein plays a role in the adherence of immature thymus cells to thymic epithelial cells._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: During Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Manipulation
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner.

Property.preferredDefinition: T-cell differentiation antigen CD6 (668 aa, ~72 kDa) is encoded by the human CD6 gene. This protein plays a role in the adherence of immature thymus cells to thymic epithelial cells.:Given.

Concepts.definition: T-cell differentiation antigen CD6 (668 aa, ~72 kDa) is encoded by the human CD6 gene. This protein plays a role in the adherence of immature thymus cells to thymic epithelial cells.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
